column4: ??? I want qemu, an emulator, to run my PC in emulation mode, that is, it would start executing the BIOS ROM just as if my PC had just come out of reset -it would read reset vector, and so forth.
I tried Virtual Box and BOCHS and couldn't get either to work at all.
Simply trying to run qemu on my machine -which is booted with a live Ubuntu 10.04.4 CD which is how I am speaking to you now (via Empathy). I want to run qemu in a terminal window.
Can't emulate my PC???
No, I can't run qemu -but it at least works a lot closer (compile, etc works).

The ACTUAL problem I'm trying to solve is to install Ubuntu on this computer, and to do that I have to debug GRUB2, and to do that I figure I have to run my PC in virtualization and use GDB to debug it.
Perhaps I have to copy my ROM image into a file so it is used instead of SeaBIOS ?
what the crap .. why do you need to debug grub?
just use a different bootloader
When I've tried installing Ubuntu, I get "error: file not found. grub rescue>" and can't get beyond that. Been working on this problem for MONTHS...
my vote is use syslinux.  It's less dumb.
Perhaps I am confused about emulation... everything... anyway, like I said, been working at this for months... 1000 hours at least.
Not to mention WAY less complex ... you can have a setup in under 10 lines
I have not tried other Linux, only Ubuntu 10.04
Which works on live CD just fine, but can't get it on hard drive. One hard drive.
Computer is HP Pavilion desktop, not sure exact model, but 2.2GHz anyway, 500GB HD
Yes, computer ran Windows fine -certain it is not hardware problem.
Ran Windows Vista
No 'out of disk' error. My research says Grub2 doesn't have that problem since it bypasses the BIOS totally -that was only GRUB legacy.
dude, you are making this WAY too comples
*complex
Perhaps, but I just don't know any other way. :(
